content: Compose a gospel hymn expressing gratitude and devotion. The lyrics should resonate with deep faith and reverence, using biblical references where appropriate.

In the quiet of the morning, as the dawn breaks through,

I lift my hands in worship, my heart overflows true.

For You are my Shepherd, I shall not want,

In Your presence, I find my strength and my song.

Chorus:

Oh, how I adore You, Lord of all,

In every season, You never fail.

With each breath I take, I give You praise,

My heart overflows, in Your love I stay.

Verse 2:

Like Moses at the burning bush, I hear Your call,

To walk in obedience, to stand tall.

Through the desert and the sea, You guide my way,

With every step, I feel Your love each day.

Chorus:

Oh, how I adore You, Lord of all,

In every season, You never fail.

With each breath I take, I give You praise,

My heart overflows, in Your love I stay.

Bridge:

Oh, the wonder of Your grace,

The depth of Your love, a treasure to embrace.

From the Psalms to the prophets, Your word rings true,

In every chapter, Your love shines through.

Chorus:

Oh, how I adore You, Lord of all,

In every season, You never fail.

With each breath I take, I give You praise,

My heart overflows, in Your love I stay.

Outro:

So here's to the God who holds the universe in His hands,

To the One who loves me, His child, through all lands.

Oh, how I adore You, Lord of all,

In Your love, I find my home, standing tall.
